Example

  1. Write down the Cartesian form of the equation of the straight line which passes through the two points \((9,3,-2)\) and \((4,5,-1)\).

  2. State the equivalent vector equation.

Solution

  1. The Cartesian equation of the line is \(\dfrac{x-9}{4-9}=\dfrac{y-3}{5-3}= \dfrac{z-(-2)}{-1-(-2)},\) that is \(\dfrac{x-9}{-5}= \dfrac{y-3}{2} = \dfrac{z+2}{1}.\)
  2. The vector equation of the line is \[ \underline{ r}=\underline{ a} +t(\underline{ b}-\underline{ a})\] \[= \begin{bmatrix} 9 \\ 3 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix} + t\left( \begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 5 \\ -1 \end{bmatrix}- \begin{bmatrix} 9 \\ 3 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix}\right)\]\[=\begin{bmatrix} 9 \\ 3 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix} + t \begin{bmatrix} -5 \\ 2 \\1 \end{bmatrix}.\]
